Course_Name: Open Source and IP in the Digital Society Summer 2024

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Term paper deadline extended by one week

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Dear participants, The end of our course is approaching fast. Since multiple teams have asked with good reasons for an extension of the term paper deadline, I am extending the deadline for everybody by one week. The new term paper deadline is 15 July. The course description has been updated accordingly. Please submit before the end of 15 July either in the "Sharing term papers with participants" thread in the discussion forum or by emailing the paper PDF to me. All the best, Mirko.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Please register for the term paper presentations

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Dear participants, It is almost time to present your term papers! Please register for the presentation date and time here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Wnj4BfSbtFhdBkTMhk6H_gKhJDGzoIQWZaNp8Sb9ZEs/edit?usp=sharing The term paper deadline remains 08 July. In case there are any issues with that, please get in touch early on. All the best, Mirko.

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Dear participants,  A friendly reminder - The term paper presentations will commence next week. Please make sure to register for a presentation slot. If you haven't delivered your progress presentation as of yet, please be aware that those are mandatory to be able to submit the term paper. Make sure to reach out to me via email to set up an alternative way to present your progress this week (e.g., via a video conference or as a written progress update). All the best, Mirko.

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Dear participants, due to travel there will be no lecture on Monday, 24 June. Instead, both sessions 10 and 11 will be held on 1 July between 10:0 and 14:00. All the best, Mirko.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Essay Competition by European Digital SME Alliance

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Dear participants, I thought this may be interesting to you: DIGITAL SME is running an essay competition with a theme of "ICT Standardization". You can find more information here: http://www.digitalsme.eu/essay-competition/ Maybe your term papers could turn into an essay? All the best, Mirko.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Visit at the Steel factory of GMH Group!

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Dear students, I would like to inform you about the possibility to participate at a factory visit at the steel factory of GMH Group in Osnabrück on the 28th of June. The steel factory is partly run by our former PhD Anne-Marie Großmann, who is one of the 100 most influential women in the German economy (Link) and actively transitioning her company to green steel production (Link). She is a very prominent figure in the green steel transition and I am thus very proud that we are able to visit the company's factory. Our general plan is to depart Berlin early in the morning via bus or train and be back in Berlin in the early evening, so you can enjoy your Friday evening as well. Bear in mind that the Chair of Innovation Economics will organize the transportation and cover the travel costs. As seats are very limited (only 20 people incl. me can visit the factory), it is very important that you really attend if you signed up. If you’re interested, please write an email to Julia Gräfe (julia.graefe@tu-berlin.de). Best regards, Sokol Tominaj

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Student Assistant Position at the Chair of Innovation Economics

Messages.Author: Charlotte Rochell
Messages.Content: Dear students, The Chair of Innovation Economics is looking for a teaching and research assistant (40h/month). We offer you insights into the chair's work, teaching, academic research, high flexibility, and a great work environment. German language skills are not a requirement for this position. You can find the job posting here https://www.jobs.tu-berlin.de/en/job-postings/183235 . The application deadline is 20.06.2024. If you have any questions regarding the position, don't hesitate to contact Sokol Tominaj or me. We are looking forward to your applications!  Have a lovely end of the week, Charlotte

Messages.Author: Sokol Tominaj
Messages.Content: Deal students, Thank you for your Interest in the course. The first lecture of the course takes place on 22 of April in H1029. Best, Sokol

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Dear participants, It is always appreciated if you could share your term papers with the other participants so that they can follow it during your presentation. If you want to do so, please share the PDF by replying to this post.  If not, please submit your term paper by emailing it to me. All the best, Mirko.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Reminder: Double session on 13 May, remaining flash presentations

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Dear students, just a reminder that on 13 May, we will have a double session to make up for 20 May which is a public holiday. This means there will be two lectures from 10:00 to 14:00 in total. The remaining flash presentations will be held as part of the first session. Best, Mirko.

Messages.Author: Imad Ibrahem
Messages.Content: Hi Everybody,  I'm still looking for a research partner. If someone is interested please write me a private message.  Thanks, Imad

Messages.Author: Yagiz Erayan
Messages.Content: Can group E please text me their numbers so we can create a whatsapp group

Messages.Author: Benjamin Hilliger
Messages.Content: Hey everyone, I want to recommend the Netflix Miniseries "Billion Dollar Code" to everyone who is interested in  Intellectual Property. It displays a good example of why intellectual property is important and how big tech tries to get around. Hope you find it interesting. Cheers

Messages.Author: Justus Otto Bauer
Messages.Content: Hello everyone, I'm looking for a research partner for the Term Paper. Going through the suggest topics I find the topics 24 - 27 (patents, informal standard setting, lock-in effects of proprietary software, relationship between freedom of information goods and political freedom )and 31 - 36 (standard setting by/or through FOSS communities, benefits of standards set by FOSS communities, barriers and difficulties of standard setting for FOSS, interaction between FOSS communities and standard setting bodies). If any of that sounds interesting to you let me know. Kind regards, Justus

Messages.Author: Sven Amberg
Messages.Content: I'm interested

Messages.Author: Justus Otto Bauer
Messages.Content: If someone is still looking, so am I because my potential partner decided to drop out of the course.

Messages.Author: Parisa Ebrahimi
Messages.Content: Justus I wrote you private. I also don't have a group yet.

Messages.Author: Syed Ali Murad Tahir
Messages.Content: Hello Everyone, I am looking for a partner who's interested in the following topics: The cost structure of FOSS communities and the corresponding funding sources The formal and informal decision-making processes in FOSS communities Are contributions of different kind - say coding, user support, design, or community outreach - valued the same, or is there discrimination? The individual motivation to contribute to FOSS without direct monetary remuneration: Ever wondered why contributors spend their time on FOSS? What are the business cases and reasons for companies and other organizations to invest in contributing to FOSS projects?

Messages.Author: Justus Otto Bauer
Messages.Content: I sent you a message via chat.

Messages.Author: Navyug Singh
Messages.Content: Hello, because my actual research partner does not participate anymore, I need a new one (write me a PN). I have some ideas which topic could be interesting, especially if you have also taken the course: IPM in the last semester (would also be open to other topics): 34. What are the legal and licensing requirements for formal standards that relate to FOSS? Are there certain preconditions that are needed to be able to implement a formal standard in open source? What about SEPs (standard essential patents)? Also review the (F)RAND vs Royalty Free debate, and how it relates to the four freedoms of software. 24. How do businesses involved in FOSS activities value patent assets? Do businesses with FOSS activities apply for or acquire patents? What is their patent management strategy? How are the patents used? 18. The individual motivation to contribute to FOSS without direct monetary remuneration: Ever wondered why contributors spend their time on FOSS? Write a paper about it! 10. The cost structure of FOSS communities and the corresponding funding sources: Describe the cost structure of FOSS communities or foundationss and how the communities are raising funds to cover these costs. This could be a case study about one ore multiple communities. Many communities publish their annual statements of accounts, which can be used as a starting point for research.

Messages.Author: Benjamin Hilliger
Messages.Content: Hello,  I am looking for a partner for the research project.Two topics I find interesting are the open source platform home assistant and open source in the public domain, especially in replacing Windows with Linux in administrations. But I am also open to other topics, so if you are also still looking for a partner I am confident we can find some overlapping interests. Just comment on this post or write me in the chat. Cheers, Benni

Messages.Author: Navyug Singh
Messages.Content: Hello, sounds interesting. Lets contact!

Messages.Author: Benjamin Hilliger
Messages.Content: There was a misunderstanding, so I am still looking for a partner. Please message me, if you still need a group.

Messages.Author: Yagiz Erayan
Messages.Content: Is there a mistake or the lecture on Monday is 4 hours? It says 10-14  Just double checking so im there on time

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Question regarding the correct dates for registration and formal acceptance to the course

Messages.Author: Georgios Karategos
Messages.Content: Dear OSIP team,  On the couse description document, particularly in Appendix A - Important dates, summer term 2024, I am reading the following:  Course registration opens on 15 April 2024 and closes on 21 April 2024. There is a limitation to 30 participants. You will receive an email with a confirmation on 22 April if you have been accepted into the course.  I suppose these dates are now shifted to 22-28th of April regarding the filling of the registration form and possibly 29th of April for the acceptance email, so the definitive source regarding this detail is what is stated at the first page of the ISIS course, am I correct?  Thank you in advance for your reply.  Cheers George

Messages.Author: Mirko Böhm
Messages.Content: Hello, Good catch. The correct dates are 22-28 April for the registration period. The course description has been updated. Best, Mirko.
